Bases: flask_wtf.form.FlaskForm

validate_resident_email(field)[source]¶

Validates that the provided resident email exists. This is to thwart malicious input.

Parameters:
  • form – The AddPackageForm that was submitted.
  • field – The resident_email field.
Raises:

ValidationError – If resident_email does not correspond to an existing account.

  • field – The email field.

Validates that the uploaded file is not empty and is a real PNG.

  • field – The profile_picture field.
Raises:

ValidationError – If profile_picture is empty or not a valid png.

ovs.forms.validators module¶

Validators for reuse in forms

class ovs.forms.validators.EmailRegistered(check, message=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Validates that an email is or is not registered.

Parameters:
  • check – Whether to validate that the email is registered or unregistered.
  • message – The message to be displayed to the user on the form if the check fails. If no message is provided the message will either be: “Email must be an existing user” or “Email already in use”
__call__(form, field)[source]¶

Does the validation.

Parameters:
  • form – The form this validator is applied to.
  • field – The field this validator is applied to.
Raises:

ValidationError – If the given email is unregistered if check=True and if the given email is registered if check=False.
__init__(check, message=None)[source]¶

Recieves paramaters for the validator
